answers.answer: "Could this be caused from the diabetes, can I be starting to have a stroke?"The onset of Diabetes Neuropathy yes."I try to watch my sweets and carbs, although I'm not always successful with it.."You need to try much harder to avoid sugary foods & liquids, foods made with white flour [breads, crackers, etc], white rice, starchy foods like potatoes. A poor diabetes diet will escalate your diabetes side effects."Is there any OC meds I can take?"No. The keys to controlling and managing t2 diabetes are proper nutrition, maintaining proper body weight, perform 30 minutes of daily physical exercise like walking, and keeping a normal lipid panel and blood pressure. Doing and keeping these inline lessens the need for medication.Do you know of a free clinic in your area? Google search for one. Also, Google your area hospitals to see if they have a "care van", or something to that nature, that helps the homeless. Care vans go to specific locations to provide medical care and medication/s to those who cannot afford it. You need to get back on medication asap. If you must go to the ER. Please get medical attention before your symptoms worsen. Good luck

question: I am a 60 year old female that was diagnosed with Type 2 about 7 years ago.  I was on medication to control it but had reached a point to where I should start insulin.  About 9 months ago due to finacial problems and I had to drop insurance etc..........my point being I had to quit all my meds (Metformin, Victoza, Cymbalta, Vytorin, Levothyroxin and Lisinopril). I try to watch my sweets and carbs, although I'm not always successful with it, and that is all I'm doing at this point.  I have recently started experiencing pains in my legs, even so bad that they hurt to the touch, burning sensations (like sunburn) from middle of body to top of my head, itching when I try to sleep and lately headaches. These symptoms occur mostly at night.  I've also have loss 58 lbs without trying.   Could this be caused from the diabetes, can I be starting to have a stroke?  Is there any OC meds I can take?  Please if anyone has any advice, info etc. please tell me. I'm starting to get very concerned.
